text: (lively music)

- Next Gen Stats is the
department within the NFL,

which collects and utilizes
all the tracking data

on the players for every
snap in every game.

- AWS is the engine that drives
innovation at Next Gen Stats

and throughout the
National Football League.
- So over the years,

especially as we've grown to
work very closely with AWS,

every off season we've kind of
focused on a specific thing.
So now we can tell you
not just how fast someone is running,

whether the defense is
running Cover 6 or Cover 2.

- The Big Data Bowl is
an annual competition

that lets competitors
take Next Gen Stats data
and make their own stat.

Pressure probability came
out of the 2023 Big Data Bowl
where participants were given

offensive and defensive
line player tracking data

to create the next new
stat for the trenches.

- So, being able to take what
we found in the Big Data Bowl,

present those findings
to the AWS Gen AI team,

and have them actually
build a better model,

a more productionized model,
and then hand that off to us,
has been just absolutely crucial
in our stat development every off season.
And because they're able to test

so many different models
with their architecture,

we get very high performing
models, which has been great.

- It's great to have a
tech partner like AWS
to guide us through new waters
and new technological advancements.

Having AWS as a tech partner
helps guide us through
the new advancements in this field.
